intro: Elaphoglossum yungense, commonly known as the Yungense holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically bright green and finely divided. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
